parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Involved in, held in, hence: liable, generally with dat. (or gen.) of the punishment. From enecho; liable to.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
